item.title: If($session->) being stubborn
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Justin Bieber:

well now i want to know how sessions can have functions… i didn’t know this was a thing

You can build a function based on whether a function is set or not. And use session variables to build functions. o.O

item.title: If($session->) being stubborn
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

you’re saying the login button doesn’t show?

it’s because you included it in the loggedIn method.

<?php
    if($session->logged_in) { //is logged in
        echo '<li><a href="process.php">Logout</a></li>';

        if($session->isAdmin()) { //is admin and logged in
            echo '<li><a href="admin/">Admin Panel</a></li>';
        } else { //not admin and logged in 
            //here is where you had the login button 
        }
    } else { //is not logged in
        echo '<li><a href="#">Login</a></li>';
    }
?>

Read full topic

item.title: If($session->) being stubborn
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

I’m not too sure if that’s going too work Buckey.

I have already defined anything that is needed:

<?php
include("include/session.php");
global $database;
$config = $database->getConfigs();
?>

Admin Panel shows up when logged in as well as the logout button but “Login” isn’t showing itself.

Thanks for the suggestion though.

Read full topic

item.title: If($session->) being stubborn
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

So this:

<?php
							if($session->logged_in){
						echo '<li><a href="process.php">Logout</a></li>';
							if($session->isAdmin()){
      					echo '<li><a href="admin/">Admin Panel</a></li>';
							} else {
								echo '<li><a href="#">Login</a></li>';
							}
						}
?>

is being stubborn and I just cant seem to figure out why. Login will not show up to save my life. Any ideas?

Read full topic
